death_place.zh-cn: 加利福尼亚州洛思加图斯

description.zh-cn: 美籍华裔历史学家、社会活动家、作家，以其关于南京大屠杀的著作《南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀》而闻名。
description.en: A Chinese-American historian, activist, and author, best known for her book 'The Rape of Nanking: The Forgotten Holocaust of World War II'.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如的出生地。
description.en: The birthplace of Iris Chang.

zh-cn: 加利福尼亚州洛思加图斯

description.zh-cn: 张纯如的逝世地。
description.en: The place of death of Iris Chang.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如获得文学硕士学位的大学。
description.en: The university where Iris Chang obtained her Master of Arts degree.

nodes.id: 伊利诺伊大学厄巴纳-香槟分校

zh-cn: 伊利诺伊大学厄巴纳-香槟分校
伊利诺大学厄巴纳香槟分校

description.zh-cn: 张纯如毕业并获得新闻学位的大学。
description.en: The university where Iris Chang graduated with a degree in journalism.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如的丈夫。
description.en: The husband of Iris Chang.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如的父亲，理论物理学博士。
description.en: Father of Iris Chang, a Ph.D. in theoretical physics.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如的母亲，生物化学博士。
description.en: Mother of Iris Chang, a Ph.D. in biochemistry.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如的儿子。
description.en: The son of Iris Chang.

nodes.id: 南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀

zh-cn: 南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀
en: The Rape of Nanking: The Forgotten Holocaust of World War II

description.zh-cn: 张纯如撰写的关于南京大屠杀的英文历史著作，引起了国际社会的广泛关注。
description.en: A historical book written by Iris Chang about the Nanjing Massacre, which garnered widespread international attention.

description.zh-cn: 侵华日军于1937年12月13日攻占中国南京后制造的大规模屠杀、强奸以及纵火、抢劫等战争罪行与反人类罪行。张纯如的著作使其在西方世界广为人知。
description.en: A mass murder and war rape committed by Japanese troops against the residents of Nanjing, then the capital of China, during the Second Sino-Japanese War. Iris Chang's book brought widespread awareness of it to the Western world.

description.zh-cn: 中国空气动力学家，中国载人航天奠基人，被誉为“中国导弹之父”。张纯如为其撰写了传记《中国导弹之父——钱学森之谜》。
description.en: A Chinese aerodynamicist and founding figure of China's manned space program, known as the 'Father of Chinese rocketry'. Iris Chang wrote his biography 'Thread of the Silkworm'.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如的父母张绍进和张盈盈曾在此学习或任教。
description.en: Iris Chang's parents, Chang Shao-chin and Chang Ying-ying, studied or taught at this university.

description.zh-cn: 美国通讯社，张纯如曾在此工作。
description.en: An American news agency where Iris Chang once worked.

description.zh-cn: 美国报纸，张纯如曾在此工作。
description.en: An American newspaper where Iris Chang once worked.

nodes.id: 中国导弹之父——钱学森之谜

zh-cn: 中国导弹之父——钱学森之谜

description.zh-cn: 张纯如的第一本著作，关于钱学森返回中国的史实和时代背景。
description.en: Iris Chang's first book, about the historical facts and background of Qian Xuesen's return to China.

description.zh-cn: 授予张纯如“和平与国际合作计划”奖的基金会。
description.en: The foundation that awarded Iris Chang the 'Peace and International Cooperation Program' award.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如撰写的关于美国华人历史的专著。
description.en: A book written by Iris Chang about the history of Chinese people in America.

description.zh-cn: 一种精神障碍，张纯如在2004年患上严重的忧郁症，并最终因此自杀。
description.en: A mental disorder. Iris Chang suffered from severe depression in 2004 and ultimately committed suicide as a result.

description.zh-cn: 美国联邦政府的主要情报机构之一。张纯如在遗书中声称自己被该组织盯上。
description.en: One of the principal intelligence agencies of the United States federal government. Iris Chang claimed in her suicide note that she was being targeted by this organization.

description.zh-cn: 一个由美籍华人精英组成的非营利组织，张纯如曾是其成员。
description.en: A non-profit organization of prominent Chinese Americans, of which Iris Chang was a member.

description.zh-cn: 一位曾被指控为中华人民共和国窃取美国核武器机密的华裔美国科学家。张纯如曾公开谴责对他的不公平做法。
description.en: A Taiwanese-American scientist who was accused of stealing U.S. nuclear secrets for the People's Republic of China. Iris Chang publicly condemned the unfair practices against him.

description.zh-cn: 一份美国国会报告，声称中华人民共和国从美国窃取了核武器技术。张纯如曾公开反驳其中的错误。
description.en: A U.S. congressional report that alleged the People's Republic of China had stolen nuclear weapons technology from the United States. Iris Chang publicly rebutted errors within it.

en: The New York Times Best Seller list

description.zh-cn: 广受关注的畅销书排行榜，《南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀》曾登上此榜十周。
description.en: A widely followed list of best-selling books. 'The Rape of Nanking' was on this list for ten weeks.

description.zh-cn: 德国商人约翰·拉贝在南京大屠杀期间的日记，是张纯如写作《南京暴行》时引用的重要资料之一。
description.en: The diaries of German businessman John Rabe during the Nanjing Massacre, which were one of the important sources Iris Chang used when writing 'The Rape of Nanking'.

description.zh-cn: 美国传教士明妮·魏特琳在南京大屠杀期间的日记，是张纯如写作《南京暴行》时引用的重要资料之一。
description.en: The diary of American missionary Minnie Vautrin during the Nanjing Massacre, which was one of the important sources Iris Chang used when writing 'The Rape of Nanking'.

description.zh-cn: 美国历史学家，曾批评张纯如的著作《南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀》存在缺陷。
description.en: An American historian who criticized Iris Chang's book 'The Rape of Nanking' as being flawed.

description.zh-cn: 美国历史学家，曾称赞张纯如为“可能是美国最优秀的年轻历史学家”。
description.en: An American historian who described Iris Chang as 'possibly the best young historian in the U.S.'

description.zh-cn: 美国华裔组织，曾授予张纯如“年度风云女性奖”。
description.en: An organization of Chinese Americans that awarded Iris Chang the 'Woman of the Year' award.

description.zh-cn: 授予张纯如荣誉博士学位的学院。
description.en: A college that awarded an honorary doctorate to Iris Chang.

nodes.id: 加州州立大学东湾分校

zh-cn: 加州州立大学东湾分校

description.zh-cn: 授予张纯如荣誉博士学位的大学。
description.en: A university that awarded an honorary doctorate to Iris Chang.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国前总统，于2015年追授张纯如褒扬令。
description.en: Former President of the Republic of China who posthumously awarded a presidential citation to Iris Chang in 2015.

nodes.id: 侵华日军南京大屠杀遇难同胞纪念馆

zh-cn: 侵华日军南京大屠杀遇难同胞纪念馆

description.zh-cn: 位于南京的纪念馆，馆内立有张纯如的纪念塑像。
description.en: A memorial hall in Nanjing that houses a memorial statue of Iris Chang.

description.zh-cn: 位于斯坦福大学的公共政策智库，内存放有张纯如的纪念雕塑。
description.en: A public policy think tank at Stanford University that houses a memorial sculpture of Iris Chang.

description.zh-cn: 为纪念张纯如而建立的纪念馆，于2017年开馆。
description.en: A memorial hall established in memory of Iris Chang, opened in 2017.

description.zh-cn: 为纪念张纯如而建立的公园，于2019年开放。
description.en: A park established in memory of Iris Chang, opened in 2019.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如出生于新泽西州普林斯顿。
description.en: Iris Chang was born in Princeton, New Jersey.

relationships.target: 伊利诺伊大学厄巴纳-香槟分校

description.zh-cn: 张纯如毕业于伊利诺伊大学厄巴纳-香槟分校新闻系。
description.en: Iris Chang graduated from the Department of Journalism at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如在约翰·霍普金斯大学获得写作研讨班的文学硕士学位。
description.en: Iris Chang received her Master of Arts degree from the Writing Seminars at Johns Hopkins University.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如与大学同学布雷特·道格拉斯结婚。
description.en: Iris Chang married her college classmate Bretton Douglas.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如是张绍进的女儿。
description.en: Iris Chang is the daughter of Chang Shao-chin.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如是张盈盈的女儿。
description.en: Iris Chang is the daughter of Chang Ying-ying.

description.zh-cn: Christopher是张纯如的儿子。
description.en: Christopher is the son of Iris Chang.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如曾在美联社工作。
description.en: Iris Chang worked at the Associated Press.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如曾在《芝加哥论坛报》工作。
description.en: Iris Chang worked at the Chicago Tribune.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如生前是美国华人组织百人会的成员。
description.en: During her lifetime, Iris Chang was a member of the Committee of 100, a Chinese American organization.

relationships.target: 南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀

description.zh-cn: 张纯如撰写并出版了《南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀》。
description.en: Iris Chang wrote and published 'The Rape of Nanking: The Forgotten Holocaust of World War II'.

relationships.target: 中国导弹之父——钱学森之谜

description.zh-cn: 张纯如撰写并出版了她的第一本著作《中国导弹之父——钱学森之谜》。
description.en: Iris Chang wrote and published her first book, 'Thread of the Silkworm'.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如撰写并出版了专著《美国华人：一部叙述史》。
description.en: Iris Chang wrote and published the book 'The Chinese in America'.

relationships.source: 南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀

description.zh-cn: 该书详细叙述了南京大屠杀的历史，首次让西方国家全面了解了日本犯下的罪行，打破了长期的沉默。
description.en: The book details the history of the Nanjing Massacre, providing the Western world with a comprehensive understanding of the crimes committed by Japan for the first time, breaking a long silence.

relationships.source: 中国导弹之父——钱学森之谜

description.zh-cn: 该书是关于钱学森返回中国的史实和时代背景的传记。
description.en: The book is a biography about the historical facts and context of Qian Xuesen's return to China.

description.zh-cn: 张绍进是国立台湾大学物理系的理论物理学博士。
description.en: Chang Shao-chin was a Ph.D. in theoretical physics from the Department of Physics at National Taiwan University.

description.zh-cn: 张盈盈曾是国立台湾大学的生物化学教授。
description.en: Chang Ying-ying was a professor of biochemistry at National Taiwan University.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如因患上严重的忧郁症，于2004年11月9日自杀身亡。
description.en: Due to severe depression, Iris Chang committed suicide on November 9, 2004.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如在遗书中声称自己被中央情报局等组织盯上，这加剧了她的精神压力。
description.en: In her suicide note, Iris Chang claimed she was being targeted by organizations like the CIA, which exacerbated her mental distress.

description.zh-cn: 在李文和被控间谍案时，张纯如公开谴责对他的不公平做法。
description.en: During the Wen Ho Lee espionage case, Iris Chang publicly condemned the unfair practices against him.

description.zh-cn: 张纯如曾公开反驳《考克斯报告》中的错误。
description.en: Iris Chang publicly rebutted errors in the Cox Report.

relationships.target: 南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀

description.zh-cn: 《拉贝日记》是张纯如撰写《南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀》时引用的重要资料之一。
description.en: The Diaries of John Rabe was one of the key sources used by Iris Chang when writing 'The Rape of Nanking'.

relationships.target: 南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀

description.zh-cn: 《沃特林日记》是张纯如撰写《南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀》时引用的重要资料之一。
description.en: Minnie Vautrin's diary was one of the key sources used by Iris Chang when writing 'The Rape of Nanking'.

relationships.target: 南京暴行：被遗忘的大屠杀

description.zh-cn: 历史学家阿尔文·库克斯批评张纯如的《南京暴行》作为历史书存在缺陷。
description.en: Historian Alvin Coox criticized Iris Chang's 'The Rape of Nanking' as being flawed as a history book.

description.zh-cn: 历史学家斯蒂芬·E·安布罗斯形容张纯如为“可能是美国最优秀的年轻历史学家”。
description.en: Historian Stephen E. Ambrose described Iris Chang as 'possibly the best young historian in the U.S.'

description.zh-cn: 麦克阿瑟基金会授予张纯如“和平及国际合作奖”。
description.en: The MacArthur Foundation awarded Iris Chang the 'Peace and International Cooperation Award'.

description.zh-cn: 美华协会授予张纯如“年度风云女性奖”。
description.en: The Organization of Chinese Americans awarded Iris Chang the 'Woman of the Year' award.

description.zh-cn: 伍斯特学院授予张纯如荣誉博士学位。
description.en: The College of Wooster awarded an honorary doctorate to Iris Chang.

relationships.source: 加州州立大学东湾分校

description.zh-cn: 加州州立大学东湾分校授予张纯如荣誉博士学位。
description.en: California State University, East Bay awarded an honorary doctorate to Iris Chang.

description.zh-cn: 时任中华民国总统马英九亲自颁发褒扬令以表彰已故的张纯如。
description.en: Then-President of the Republic of China, Ma Ying-jeou, personally issued a presidential citation to honor the late Iris Chang.

relationships.source: 侵华日军南京大屠杀遇难同胞纪念馆

description.zh-cn: 侵华日军南京大屠杀遇难同胞纪念馆内立有张纯如的纪念塑像，以纪念她为揭露历史真相所作的贡献。
description.en: The Nanjing Massacre Memorial Hall houses a memorial statue of Iris Chang to commemorate her contributions to revealing historical truth.

description.zh-cn: 胡佛研究所内存放有张纯如的纪念雕塑。
description.en: The Hoover Institution houses a memorial sculpture of Iris Chang.

description.zh-cn: 位于张纯如祖籍地淮安的张纯如纪念馆于2017年开馆，以纪念她的生平和贡献。
description.en: Located in her ancestral hometown of Huai'an, the Iris Chang Memorial Hall opened in 2017 to commemorate her life and contributions.

description.zh-cn: 位于加州圣何塞的张纯如纪念公园于2019年开放，以纪念张纯如。
description.en: The Iris Chang Park in San Jose, California, opened in 2019 to commemorate Iris Chang.
